materials.raw_text:
Fe2O3: 200 g 
 NiO: 100 g 
 (NH4)2HPO4: 50 g 
 Deionized Water: 150 g

sourcing.instructions:
Fe2O3: Chemical supply stores or online chemical suppliers. 
 NiO: Specialty chemical suppliers or online vendors. 
 (NH4)2HPO4: Pharmacy or chemical supply stores. 
 Deionized Water: Available from laboratory supply stores or can be made using a deionization system.
steps: Fe2O3: Chemical supply stores or online chemical suppliers.

1. In a clean, dry mixing bowl, add 200 g of Fe2O3.
2. Slowly incorporate 100 g of NiO into the bowl, stirring continuously to ensure even distribution.
3. Add 50 g of (NH4)2HPO4 to the mixture and continue stirring until well combined.
4. Gradually add 150 g of deionized water to the dry mixture, stirring until a homogeneous paste is formed.
preparation.raw_text:
1. In a clean, dry mixing bowl, add 200 g of Fe2O3. 
 2. Slowly incorporate 100 g of NiO into the bowl, stirring continuously to ensure even distribution. 
 3. Add 50 g of (NH4)2HPO4 to the mixture and continue stirring until well combined.
